channel.title: Latest Finextra Research Security Headlines
channel.description: The Latest Financial IT Security Headlines

item.title: Lynx raises $18m for AI-powered fraud fighting tech
item.description: Lynx, a Madrid-based firm using AI to detect and prevent fraud and financial crimes, has raised $!8 million in Seres A funding.

item.title: Mastercard and NEC team on in-store biometric payments
item.description: Mastercard is working with NEC Corporation to push the use of facial recognition technology for instore payments in Asia Pacific.

item.title: ICBC pays ransom after US hack
item.description: The US arm of Industrial and Commercial Bank of China has reportedly paid a ransom to restore its systems after a hack attack last week that disrupted trading in US Treasuries.

item.title: Lloyds warns over surge in crypto scams
item.description: Revolut is the most common recipient of Faster Payments made by crypto investment scam victims at Lloyds Banking Group, which is reporting a surge in get-rich-quick adverts on social media.

item.title: ICBC ransomware attack disrupts Treasury trades
item.description: The US arm of Industrial and Commercial Bank of China  was hit by a ransomware attack on Thursday, forcing clients to reroute some trades.

item.title: FCA warns banks over APP fraud and poor treatment of victims
item.description: With authorised push payment fraud on the rise, the FCA says banks should strengthen anti-crime systems and must treat victims of fraud better.

item.title: Contractor gets four-year jail term for defrauding bank of over £2 million
item.description: A contractor who worked for a major UK bank has been sentenced to four years in prison after he successfully diverted over £2 million of the bank's money into his own account.

item.title: Bank staff receive jail terms over £1 million fraud
item.description: Banking insiders working with an organised crime group have been sentenced on charges of stealing up to £1 million from customer accounts

item.title: HSBC warns of spike in dummy apps
item.description: HSBC has issued an urgent fraud warning after a spike in the number of UK customers downloading dummy apps that trick users into handing over financial information.

item.title: Monzo and Starling among worst performers for APP fraud reimbursements
item.description: Monzo and Starling are among the lowest scoring firms for reimbursing victims of authorised push payment fraud, according to 2022 data published by the Payment Systems Regulator.

item.title: AIB apologises for online banking glitch
item.description: Irish high street bank AIB has admitted to a glitch in its online banking service after it was highlighted by newspaper The Irish Independent.

item.title: UK consumers lost over half a billion pounds to scams in the first half of 2023
item.description: Criminals stole £580 million through unauthorised and authorised fraud in the first half of 2023, a two per cent decrease compared with the same period in 2022, according to new figures from UK Finance.

item.title: Basel Committee publishes discussion paper on digital fraud
item.description: The Basel Committee on Banking Supervision is today publishing a discussion paper on digital fraud and banking.

item.title: ST Engineering collaborates with Elevandi to support fintech startups in Singapore
item.description: ST Engineering will expand its digital and cybersecurity solutions to help financial services organisations advance their digital transformation and build next-generation technology capabilities, focusing first on those based in Southeast Asia and Australia.

item.title: ECI ships large language model application
item.description: ECI, the leader in managed services and cybersecurity for the global financial services industry, today announced the launch of its cutting-edge ECI Large Language Application (ELLA) managed platform, the first secure large language model (LLM) application for the alternative financial market and other highly regulated industries.

item.title: Feedzai and CoreCarrd form fraud busting AI pact
item.description: Feedzai, the leading provider of financial crime and risk management solutions, has partnered with CoreCard, the gold-standard international provider of prepaid and credit technology solutions and processing services to banks and the financial technology and services market.

item.title: Saudi Awwal Bank partners Mastercard
item.description: Saudi Awwal Bank (SAB) has partnered with Mastercard to offer consumers across the country greater access to secure digital transactions.

item.title: Charlie releases fraud protection tools for silver surfers
item.description: Today, Charlie, the new standard for 62+ banking services*, announced the launch of FraudShield, a comprehensive, personalized suite of fraud protection tools built exclusively for the unique needs of 62+ Americans.

item.title: Nymbus taps DataVisor for fraud management
item.description: DataVisor, the world’s leading AI-powered fraud and risk platform, is pleased to announce that it has been selected by NYMBUS®, a leading provider of cloud-based financial technology solutions, to provide comprehensive fraud management across their suite of digital banking offerings.

item.title: SurePay opens developer portal
item.description: SurePay, the pioneer behind Confirmation of Payee, is excited to introduce the SurePay Developer Portal, an innovative platform designed to empower developers with the full potential of SurePay's offerings.

item.title: NetGuardians puts SaaS offering on Google Cloud
item.description: Today, NetGuardians unveils a new Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) offering delivering its renowned AI-driven fraud prevention solutions on Google Cloud.

item.title: Clear Junction introducess Confirmation of Payee service to counter APP fraud
item.description: Clear Junction, a global leader in cross-border payments solutions for regulated institutions, has announced the launch of its new Confirmation of Payee (CoP) service.

item.title: Fingerprint Cards works with IN Group to boost production of biometric payment cards
item.description: Fingerprint Cards AB (Fingerprints™) and IN Groupe through SPS, its globally leading brand in contactless and dual interface card manufacturing technologies, have come together to collaborate on IN Groupe’s Smart Packaging Solutions (SPS).

item.title: CBA to extend scam-detecting technologies nationwide
item.description: Commonwealth Bank of Australia (CBA) today announced it is expanding its anti-scam technologies, as part of a national effort to combat the rise of increasingly complex fraud and scams.

item.title: Disrupting Financial Crime with RegTech
item.description: Costing up to $3.5 trillion annually, global financial crime demands an innovative response. By accelerating solution deployment and enhancing industry standards, Deborah Young, CEO of The RegTech Association, looks to education initiatives and collaboration to address the issue; setting the stage for the 'Regulatory Public Infrastructure' panel at this week’s Singapore FinTech Festival.

item.title: Advancing ESG practices through tech infrastructure & clearer regulations
item.description: Dr Darian McBain, Chief Executive Officer of Outsourced Chief Sustainability Officer Asia, explores the role of technology infrastructure and the need for clearer regulations to advance ESG practices. We evaluate the impact of payment rails and highlight how seamless cross-border transactions in countries like Singapore, India, and Thailand, contribute to social inclusion by addressing challenges faced by migrants. The discussion also touches on the upcoming ESG debate at this year’s Singapore Fintech Festival, where teams will weigh the possibility of the next trillion being green.

item.title: Regulatory challenges with AI require a collaborative response
item.description: Jo Ann Barefoot, Founder & Chief Executive Officer of Alliance for Innovative Regulation (AIR), discusses the challenges presented by rapidly evolving AI in the global banking landscape and examines the pace of regulatory response. In the lead up to Singapore Fintech Festival 2023, the discussion covers ethical AI innovation, the risks associated with fraud and bias, and the potential role of AI assistants in consumer protection. Jo emphasizes the importance of regulators adopting cloud technology and AI, highlighting the significance of collaborative efforts among stakeholders to navigate the intricacies of AI in banking.

item.title: Shaping Lithuania's next-generation of digital public infrastructure
item.description: Karolis Zemaitis, Vice-Minister, Ministry of the Economy & Innovation, Republic of Lithuania, explores Lithuania's next-generation digital public infrastructure, focusing on scalability, inclusivity, and investment, while tackling security and privacy concerns. The discussion includes Web3 technologies and addresses the challenges of interoperability and the global ecosystem's paradox of balancing dependence and resilience. All within the context of fostering fair and open trade driven by technology, in preparation for Singapore Fintech Festival 2023.

item.title: Navigating payments interoperability in the digital economy
item.description: Camilla Bullock, Chief Executive Officer for Emerging Payments Association Asia, delves into the role of payments interoperability in the digital economy and its facilitation of global trade ahead of Singapore Fintech Festival 2023. Together we explore the challenges linked to interoperability, from technical and regulatory hurdles, to privacy concerns and liability risks, along with the importance of accessibility and trust to achieving seamless payments in an interoperable network.

item.title: Managing compliance complexity with emerging technologies
item.description: At Sibos 2023, David White, Vice President Product, Financial Crime Compliance and Payments, LexisNexis® Risk Solutions, updates us on the areas affected by increased sanction screenings and the technologies organizations are using to address these issues.

item.title: The Perfect Payments Storm
item.description: At Sibos 2023, Dalbir Sahota, Senior Director, Product Management, LexisNexis® Risk Solutions, and Ed Metzger, Vice President, Payments, LexisNexis® Risk Solutions, discuss the financial industry's response to rising sanctions, the impact on banks and FIs correspondent networks, and the benefits of early sanction screenings in the payments process.

item.title: How can Financial Market Infrastructures advance the adoption of DLT?
item.description: At Sibos 2023, Jennifer Peve, Managing Director, Global Head of Strategy and Innovation, DTCC, discusses how Financial Market Infrastructures can help drive digitization, through the development of standards, interoperability, and balancing innovation with safety in an expanding digital asset ecosystem.

item.title: Pushing Fraud Controls to the Next Level
item.description: Isabel Schmidt, Co-Head of Global Payments Products, BNY Mellon, joins us at EBAday 2023 to discuss real-time payments and the ways to improve fraud controls with data validation services and cross-industry collaboration.

item.title: Implementing EBA's Pan-European Fraud Taxonomy: First Findings from Early Movers
item.description: Thomas Egner, Secretary General, Euro Banking Association, and Annick Moes, Head of Industry Issues and Cooperation Initiatives, Euro Banking Association, discuss at EBAday 2023 the practical impact of the EBA's pan-European taxonomies addressing KYC and fraud combatting. They share feedback from first movers, which have implemented the EBA Fraud Taxonomy for fraud analytics and customer education, and comment on the taxonomy’s increasing relevance in the context of evolving payments regulation at EU level.

item.title: Preparing for Instant Payment Regulation Across Europe
item.description: Erwin Kulk, Head of Service Development and Management, EBA CLEARING, speaks at EBAday 2023 in Madrid about the impact of instant payment regulation on EBA CLEARING's payment systems, how fraud patterns and anomaly detection can support users with upcoming regulatory requirements, and how to overcome some of the industry's greatest challenges today.

item.title: Unveiling the Impact of Instant Payments on Financial Crime Mitigation
item.description: Speaking at TCF 2023, Adam Gable, Product Director Financial Crime, Treasury & Risk, Temenos, and Hani Hagras, Chief Science Officer, Temenos, discuss what the spread of instant payments means for financial crime mitigation and how AI and automation can help prevent fraud and maintain compliance.

item.title: In Focus: Monitoring for market abuse across related instruments
item.description: Ian Hawkins, Head of Product Management, Nasdaq, discusses key trends in the surveillance space, including recent prosecutions, single instrument manipulation and the challenges found with monitoring across related securities.

item.title: Scams: The 2024 Fraud Outlook
item.description: Watch this webinar predicting what financial crime challenges will emerge in 2024 and how financial institutions can tackle them.

item.title: Consumer data privacy: Why protecting trust is essential
item.description: Watch this webinar, hosted in association with Mastercard, to explore how data and privacy has evolved in the payments industry due to digital transformation, and how banks are implementing innovative security measures to maintain customer trust.

item.title: DORA: The drive towards better operational resilience
item.description: Watch this webinar, in association with NTT DATA, on why operational resilience is an essential part of the digital financial system.

item.title: Network Analytics: How to Uncover Financial Crime Risk
item.description: Watch this webinar on the importance of network analytics with financial crime and compliance organisations, and best practices for deploying this technology.

item.title: AI regulation and innovation: Is a risk-based approach the best option for payments?
item.description: Watch this webinar, in association with Napier, to discover how AI can be responsibly implemented by payments firms to help combat financial crime.
